result.execSummary:
The defendant Alicia Joanne Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber privileges.  DNA sample to be provided.  May transfer to Eau Claire Co.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed
1 day jail credit, if probation revoked.

miscConds.notes: AODA and any follow-up.  Absolute sobriety and no possession of controlled substances without a valid Rx.  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid D/L.  Random UA's per agent.  Maintain full-time employment.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alicia Joanne Lee

records.addlTxt:

State states joint recommendation.  Atty Getsinger agrees.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 2: Dismissed but read in 

Count 1:

12 Months in Sauk County Jail, with huber or huber like privileges, consecutive to any other sentence previously imposed.  May transfer to Eau Claire Co. - IMPOSED AND STAYED
3 years Probation
1 day jail credit, if probation revoked
Provide DNA surcharge/sample
$518.00 Fine/Costs fees (PAID THRU SAUK CO. CLERK OF COURTS), 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with the Sauk Co. Clerk of Courts

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

AODA and any follow-up
Absolute sobriety and no possession of controlled substances without a valid Rx
Random UA's, per agent
No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid D/L
Maintain full-time employment
